title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: TUSCAN requires three types input data: Spatial transcriptomics count data. Spatial location information. Original histology image. used HER2-positive breast cancer sample data (patient B, replicate 1) 2021 Andersson’s paper illustration vignette. gene expression profile measured Spatial Transcriptomics (ST) platform, 293 spots 16,148 genes detected.

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: spatial raw count data \(N \times D\) matrix, rows (\(N\)) representing genes columns (\(D\)) representing spots.
code: ## load the example spatial count data data("example_count") print(example_count[1:4,1:4]) #>            10x13 10x14 10x15 10x16 #> FO538757.1     0     0     0     1 #> SAMD11         0     0     0     0 #> NOC2L          0     0     0     0 #> KLHL17         0     0     0     0

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: spatial location data dataframe row represents spatial spot. dataframe contains two columns ‘x’ ‘y’, ‘x’ representing row pixel coordinate spot histology image ‘y’ representing column pixel coordinate spot histology image. rownames spatial location dataframe match exactly colnames spatial count data.
code: ## load the example spatial location data data("example_loc") print(example_loc[1:4,]) #>             x       y #> 10x13 2573.12 3493.69 #> 10x14 2559.81 3790.17 #> 10x15 2574.28 4075.00 #> 10x16 2575.73 4373.23

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: input image original high-resolution H&E image measured sample.  provide example code read 10x Visium data.
code: ## load the example histology image image_path <- system.file("data", "example.jpg", package = "TUSCAN") img <- image_read(image_path) par(mar = c(1, 0, 1, 0)) plot(img) library(dplyr)  count.data <- Seurat::Read10X_h5("path/to/name_filtered_feature_bc_matrix.h5") loc.data <- read.csv("path/to/tissue_positions_list.csv") loc.data <- loc.data %>% filter (X0==1) loc.data <- data.frame(x=loc.data[,6],y=loc.data[,5]) image_path <- "path/to/image" img <- image_read(image_path)

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: can use createTUSCANObject() create TUSCAN object. required inputs raw count matrix, location, image. project parameter allows users name project. r image smoothing parameter. detailed explanation refer help(createTUSCANObject).
code: obj <- createTUSCANObject(counts = example_count,                            location = example_loc,                            img = img,                            project="TUSCAN",                            r=49)

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: first perform dimensional reduction spatial gene count data. step realized employing autoencoder top nhvg (default 2000) highly variable genes (HVGs). d number dimensions reduction (default 20).
code: obj <- reduceDim(object = obj, nhvg=2000,d=20,epochs=50,batch_size=64, seed = 1234) #> [1] "Start dimension reduction by autoencoder..." #> 10/10 - 0s - 327ms/epoch - 33ms/step #> [1] "Dimension reduction finished..."

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: accurately infer copy number variations (CNV) SRT data, need first recognize subset normal spots reference baseline values. first conduct preliminary clustering based spatial gene expression data histology image. Since one cluster may comprise normal cells, recommend clustering step identify likely cluster highest purity normal cluster. PreCluster() functions clusters spots. provides two clustering methods:km(K-Means) louvain (Louvain). K-Means method, number clusters k needs specified. louvain clustering, number clusters can adjusted parameter res.
code: # pre-clustering obj <- PreCluster(object = obj, method = 'km', k=6, seed = 1234) #> [1] "Found 6 clusters"

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
code: plotSpatial(obj = obj, class = "cluster", size = 5)

what: Determine the cluster selected as the reference
title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: FindNormalCluster() function can print name group previous clustering result probable normal reference.
code: FindNormalCluster(obj) #> number of iterations= 40  #> number of iterations= 59  #> number of iterations= 65  #> number of iterations= 63  #> number of iterations= 66  #> number of iterations= 137  #> [1] "Cluster 1 is selected as the normal reference."

what: Inferring the spatial copy number profile
title: Introduction to TUSCAN
text: Next can run runCNV() function construct CNV profile. essential parameters : object: TUSCAN object. ref_group_names: vector containing cluster name(s) reference spots used inferring CNV. min_ave_counts_per_gene: Minimum average gene expression level across spots (default: 0.01). min_spots_per_gene: Minimum number spots requiring expression measurements include corresponding gene (default: 3). chr_exclude: List chromosomes reference genome annotations excluded analysis (default: c(‘chrX’, ‘chrY’, ‘chrM’). normalization: Whether perform normalization step. suggest skip step SRT data generated ST platform (default: TRUE). computed copy number matrix stored slot cnv.data TUSCAN object. details runCNV() function refer help(runCNV).
code: cnv_obj <- runCNV(object = obj,                    ref_group_names = c("1"),                   min_ave_counts_per_gene=0.01,                   min_spots_per_gene=3,                   chr_exclude=c('chrX', 'chrY', 'chrM'),                   normalization = FALSE) #> [1] "create pre-CNV analysis object ..." #> [1] "filtering data ..." #> [1] "15109 genes and 295 spots in raw count matrix" #> [1] "filtered out 2357 genes with less than 0.01 average counts; remaining 12752 genes" #> [1] "filtered out 70 genes that expressed in less than 3 spots; remaining 12682 genes" #> [1] "find 12092 mathed genes in the count matrix and gene order file" #> [1] "start cnv analysis process ..." #> [1] "step 1: perform log transformation ..." #> [1] "step 2: subtract average normal spots gene expression ..." #> [1] "step 3: Apply maximum centered expression thresholds to data ..." #> [1] "step 4: smooth the data along chromosome with gene windows ..." #> [1] "step 5: center spots/observations after smoothing ..." #> [1] "step 6: subtract average reference ..." #> [1] "step 7: invert log transform ..."

previous_headings: Inferring the spatial copy number profile
title: Introduction to TUSCAN
code: plotCNVheatmap(object = cnv_obj, title = "heatmap", output_format = "png") #> agg_png  #>       2 image <- image_read("heatmap.png") par(mar = c(0.5, 0.2, 0.5, 0.2)) plot(image)

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
code: tumor <- TumorCluster(object = cnv_obj, seed = 1234)

title: Introduction to TUSCAN
code: plotSpatial(obj = tumor, class = "tumor", size = 5)

code: @Manual{,   title = {TUSCAN: Tumor Segmentation and Classification Analysis in Spatial Transcriptomics},   author = {Chenxuan Zang and Peng Wei and Ziyi Li and Charles C. Guo},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0}, }

what: Tumor Segmentation and Classification Analysis in Spatial Transcriptomics
title: Tumor Segmentation and Classification Analysis in Spatial Transcriptomics
text: TUSCAN R package aims perform tumor segmentation classification analysis constructing spatial copy number profile. TUSCAN takes gene information spatial transcriptomics data histology image input improve accuracy tumor region identification. overall workflow TUSCAN, consists three main steps. first step find subset normal spots. TUSCAN performs preliminary clustering spots based gene information dimensionally reduced autoencoder, along RGB values extracted histology image. , automatically pick cluster highest confidence representing normal cells. second step infer copy number profile spots applying selected cluster reference baseline. third step segment spots tumors non-tumors via consensus clustering copy number profile input.

title: Tumor Segmentation and Classification Analysis in Spatial Transcriptomics
text: R version >= 4.0.0. R packages: magick, Seurat, cluster, ConsensusClusterPlus, dplyr, ggplot2, igraph, keras, tensorflow, dlm, RColorBrewer, ComplexHeatmap, grid, stats

title: Tumor Segmentation and Classification Analysis in Spatial Transcriptomics
text: R package can installed github: Note TUSCAN relies keras tensorflow R package, can installed : TUSCAN depends R package ConsensusClusterPlus, encouter error trying install package: “package ‘ConsensusClusterPlus’ available version R”, please install Bioconductor:
code: # Install devtools, if necessary if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github('CZang409/TUSCAN') install.packages("keras") library(keras) install_keras() # install_keras() will install a version of TensorFlow that is compatible with the current version of the keras package. if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")  BiocManager::install("ConsensusClusterPlus")

title: Tumor Segmentation and Classification Analysis in Spatial Transcriptomics
text: Details Tutorial

title: Create a TUSCAN object — createTUSCANObject
text: Create TUSCAN object.

title: Create a TUSCAN object — createTUSCANObject
code: createTUSCANObject(counts, location, project = "TUSCAN", img, r = 49)

title: Create a TUSCAN object — createTUSCANObject
text: counts Raw spatial transcriptomics gene expression count matrix, dimension \(m \times n\), \(m\) number genes \(n\) number spots. location Dataframe containing spatial coordinates spots, row represents spot two columns represent \(x\) \(y\) coordinates spatial location, respectively. project Name project. img Histology image input. r Image smoothing parameter: draw square side length (\(2r+1\)) centered spot. Apply average color within square new RGB values. default value 49.

title: Create a TUSCAN object — createTUSCANObject
text: Return preliminary TUSCAN object.

what: Find a subset of normal spots — FindNormalCluster
title: Find a subset of normal spots — FindNormalCluster
text: function helps determine cluster highest potential purity normal spots evaluation score \(s\) combines gene expression histology image information. evaluation score \(s\) cluster calculated \(s=w \times g - (1-w) \times \sigma\), \(g\) median gray value spots within cluster extracted gray-scaled histology image, \(\sigma\) standard deviation gene expression levels within cluster, \(w\) weight image. \(g\) \(\sigma\) standardized. cluster largest \(s\) selected normal reference.

title: Find a subset of normal spots — FindNormalCluster
code: FindNormalCluster(object, w = 0.5)

title: Find a subset of normal spots — FindNormalCluster
text: object TUSCAN object. w Weight image. Default value 0.5, .e., gene expression image equally weighted.

title: Find a subset of normal spots — FindNormalCluster
text: Print name selected normal cluster.

what: Plot the copy number matrix as a heatmap, with spots as rows and genes as columns, ordered according to chromosome — plotCNVheatmap

title: Spatial plotting functions — plotSpatial
text: obj TUSCAN object. color Optional color palette can customized user. size Point size. cluster Options: "cluster","tumor".

title: Spatial plotting functions — plotSpatial
text: Return spatial plot

what: Preliminary clustering integrating spatial gene expression data and histology image — PreCluster
title: Preliminary clustering integrating spatial gene expression data and histology image — PreCluster
text: function performs preliminary clustering spots based spatial gene expression matrix histology image. aim step select subset normal spots reference infer copy number profile later. recommend using larger number clusters make selected reference group purer. recommend reference group contains least 10 spots reduce potential bias.

title: Preliminary clustering integrating spatial gene expression data and histology image — PreCluster
code: PreCluster(object, res = NULL, method = c("louvain", "km"), k = 5, seed = NULL)

title: Preliminary clustering integrating spatial gene expression data and histology image — PreCluster
text: object TUSCAN object. res Optional resolution parameter louvain clustering allows user adjust number clusters. Larger values typically yield clusters. method Clustering method. Options: c('louvain',"km") k Number clusters K-Means. seed Optional numerical value. Set random seed reproducible results.

title: Preliminary clustering integrating spatial gene expression data and histology image — PreCluster
text: Return processed TUSCAN object adding preliminary clustering results.

what: Perform dimension reduction by autoencoder — reduceDim
title: Perform dimension reduction by autoencoder — reduceDim
text: Perform dimension reduction autoencoder.

title: Perform dimension reduction by autoencoder — reduceDim
code: reduceDim(   object,   nhvg = 2000,   d = 20,   epochs = 50,   batch_size = 64,   seed = NULL )

title: Perform dimension reduction by autoencoder — reduceDim
text: object TUSCAN object. nhvg Number highly variable genes run autoencoder. d Number dimensions compressed autoencoder. epochs Number training iterations. batch_size Number training samples utilized one iteration. seed Optional numerical value. Set random seed reproducible results.

title: Perform dimension reduction by autoencoder — reduceDim
text: Return processed TUSCAN object adding low-dimensional components.

title: Inferring copy number profile (CNP). — runCNV
text: function performs data filtering whole genome copy number inferring.

title: Inferring copy number profile (CNP). — runCNV
code: runCNV(   object,   gene_order_file = NULL,   annotations_file = NULL,   ref_group_names,   min_ave_counts_per_gene = 0.01,   min_spots_per_gene = 3,   chr_exclude = c("chrX", "chrY", "chrM"),   max_centered_threshold = 3,   normalization = TRUE,   normalize_factor = NULL,   window_length = 101,   denoise = TRUE )

title: Inferring copy number profile (CNP). — runCNV
text: object TUSCAN object. gene_order_file Gene location file, containing chromosome, start, stop position gene. example: chr  start   stop DDX11L1 chr1  11869  14412 WASH7P  chr1  14363  29806 FAM138A chr1  34554  36081 OR4F5   chr1  69091  70008 OR4F29  chr1 367640 368634 OR4F16  chr1 621059 622053 ... annotations_file File containing annotations spots, two columns representing spot barcode spot clustering name (support '.txt' '.csv' file). user provide annotation file, pre_cluster result used annotations. example: V1   V2 10x13    1 10x14    2 10x15    1 10x16    1 ... ref_group_names vector containing cluster name reference (normal) spots used inferring CNV. min_ave_counts_per_gene Minimum average gene expression level across spots (default: 0.01). min_spots_per_gene Minimum number spots requiring expression measurements include corresponding gene (default: 3). chr_exclude List chromosomes reference genome annotations excluded analysis (default: c('chrX', 'chrY', 'chrM'). max_centered_threshold Maximum value value can centering. Also sets lower bound -1 * value (default: 3). normalization Whether perform normalization step. suggest skip step SRT data generated ST platform (default: TRUE). normalize_factor normalize factor null (default setting), normalize_factor=median(UMI per spot)/UMI per spot. window_length Length window moving average (smoothing). odd integer (default: 101). denoise Whether perform de-noise step (default: TRUE).

title: Inferring copy number profile (CNP). — runCNV
text: Return TUSCAN object containing inferred CNV data

title: Predict tumor spots — TumorCluster
text: function implements automatic tumor segmentation classification.

title: Predict tumor spots — TumorCluster
code: TumorCluster(   object,   seed = NULL,   maxK = 3,   reps = 100,   pItem = 0.8,   pFeature = 1,   title = NULL,   clusterAlg = c("km", "hc", "pam"),   distance = c("euclidean", "pearson", "spearman", "maximum", "canberra", "minkowski") )

title: Predict tumor spots — TumorCluster
text: object TUSCAN object. seed Optional numerical value. Set random seed reproducible results. maxK Maximum cluster number evaluate. reps Number subsamples. pItem Proportion items sample. pFeature Proportion features sample. title File directory storing consensus clustering figures. clusterAlg Cluster algorithm. (default: 'km'), options('km','hc','pam'). 'km': k-means, 'hc': hierarchical (hclust), 'pam': paritioning around medoids. distance Distance function. (default: 'euclidean'), options('euclidean','pearson','spearman','maximum','canberra','minkowski').

title: Predict tumor spots — TumorCluster
text: Return processed TUSCAN object adding tumor annotations.

title: The TUSCAN Class — TUSCAN-class
text: Slots TUSCAN object include:

title: The TUSCAN Class — TUSCAN-class
text: counts.data raw expression count matrix. Rows genes, columns spots. cnv.data copy number matrix inferred raw count matrix. Rows genes, columns spots. project Name project. location spatial coordinates spots, two columns representing \(x\) \(y\) coordinates spatial location. image histology image information, including pixel location spot original histology image, color information. autoencoder outputs autoencoder. pre_cluster preliminary clustering results used select reference cluster later. tumor_cluster Tumor prediction, indicating spot 'tumor' 'normal'. annotation Annotations spots, two columns representing spot barcode spot clustering name. user provide annotation file, pre_cluster result used annotations. gene_order gene order file, contains chromosome, start, stop position gene. reference_grouped_spot_indices indices reference spots. observation_grouped_spot_indices indices spots.
